intro: Aegiphila pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
